bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington. Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of John McKinnon for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
U.S. Marshal's Return
Now comes James C. Drake, the United States Marshal for the District of Washington, and for his answer and return to the rule heretofore made in this cause requiringg him to show cause before this court why a writ of habeas corpus should not issue herein as prayed:
Showeth:
That said John McKinnon was arrested upon a warrant issued by A. H. Kenyon, Esq., a commissioner of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, upon a complaint made upon the oath of E.C. Simmons, a special agent of the Gobernment of the Province of British Columbia, said province being one of the provinces of Great Britain, between which said last named government and the United States there exists a treaty and convention providing for the extradition of persons charged with larceny and other crimes, charging the said John McKinnon with the crime of larceny committed in said province on or about the 18th day of August, 1895, by then and there unlawfully, wilfully and feloniously stealing, taking and carrying away four neat cattle of the value of fifty dollars, of the goods and chattels of one Cornelius O'Keefe, contrary to the laws of said province.
That said Kenyon as said commissioner had full power and authority to issue said warrant and hear said complaint and the evidence offered, and commit said John McKinnon to the custody of the Marshal of said district until he could, by proper proceedings, be extradited to said province, or otherwise dealt with
according to law.
That thereafter, on the 23rd day of December, 1896, the said John McKinnon was brought before said commissioner to answer said charge, and the evidence in support of said charge and on behalf of said John McKinnon was introduced before said commissioner, and the said commissioner after hearing said evidence and carefully considering the same found that the said offense, as charged, had been comitted, and that said John McKinnon was guilty of committing said offense as charged. Thereupon said commissioner ordered that said John McKinnon be committed to the custody of the marshal of the United States for said district in the County Jail of Spokane County, Washington, to await the warrant of extradition, and him there safely kept, until he be discharged by due course of law, and said commissioner then and there issued under his hand and seal a proper warrant of commitment containing said order, and delivered the said warrant together with the body of said John McKinnon to the undersigned Marshal, and that the undersigned as such marshal now has said John McKinnon in his custody in said county jail of said Spokane County under and by virtue of said warrant of commitment and not otherwise. (Said warrant of commitment is herewith attached and made a part of this return.)
Wherefore, the undersigned as said marshal prays the judgment of this court whether he should make any other or further return herein, and further prays that said application be dismissed, and that he have and recover his costs herein.
James C. Drake Unites States Marshal for the District of Washington.
State of Washington County of Pierce
ss.
James C. Drake, of lawful age, being first duly sworn, upon his oath says:
That he is the marshal of the United States for the District of Washington; that he has read the foregoing answer and return to the rule to show cause herein and understands the contents thereof and that the facts therein stated are true as he verily believes.
James C Drake
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 26 day of January, 1897.
James S Midges
Deputy
CLERK UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
(Seal)
Tx.
No. 593.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In re John McKinnon
Petitioner Exh
for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Marshal's Return to Order to Show Cause.
Filed Jan 27 1897 -IN THE- U.S. CIRCUIT COURT. A. Reeves Ayres. CLERK
By A. N. Moore. DEPUTY.
WM. H. BRINKER UNITED STATES ATTORNEY SEATTLE, WASHINGTON
